snippet: The federal appeals court ruling blocked the president’s plan to provide work permits to millions of undocumented immigrants while shielding most of them from deportation.
abstract: Pres Barack Obama asks Supreme Court to review court of appeals ruling that deemed immigration program providing nearly five million undocumented immigrants with ability to legally live and work in US exceeds his authority as president; Supreme Court ruling will likely set precedent by limiting or expanding executive power based on decision.
lead_paragraph: The federal appeals court ruling blocked the president’s plan to provide work permits to millions of undocumented immigrants while shielding most of them from deportation.

headline.main: Obama to Appeal Immigration Ruling to Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Fate of 5 Million at Stake, Obama to Ask Justices to Rule on Immigration Overhaul
